summary: This document is a chain of emails from September 2021 regarding a discovery request for the Epstein/Maxwell case. It involves FBI Victim Services personnel coordinating to provide communications (emails, texts) with a victim/witness. The emails discuss the retrieval of 5 specific emails and the loss of text messages due to a device update.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Named as a subject of the New York investigation (50D-NY-3027571) which is scheduled for trial.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Named as a subject of the New York investigation (50D-NY-3027571) which is scheduled for trial.

events.title: Epstein/Maxwell Trial Date
events.description: The New York investigation of Jeffrey Epstein/Ghislaine Maxwell (50D-NY-3027571) is scheduled for trial.

keyFacts: The FBI Victim Services Division was actively gathering communications (emails, texts, voicemails) with victims/witnesses for discovery in the Epstein/Maxwell case in September 2021.
An FBI employee from the Seattle FBI - Bellingham RA reported having 5 email communications with a victim/witness, but text messages were lost due to a Bureau-issued device update.
The discovery request had a tight deadline, with information requested by COB Monday, September 13, 2021, highlighting the pre-trial preparation timeline.
The document references a specific case number for the New York investigation: 50D-NY-3027571.
The email chain indicates coordination between a Program Manager in the FBI Victim Services Division and an FBI employee in the field to comply with discovery obligations.
